intro: Lisianthius domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly the Dominican Republic. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight. Its flowers are usually pink or purple, and they bloom in the summer months. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
